WorkItem.Description: This is funny. The header just disapears.
WorkItem.Summary: DataGrid: Setting a Visual parent's IsEnabled property to False causes DataGridColumnHeader to disapear.

Comments.Message: Thanks for a simple repro.  It looks like the problem is that something in the template is binding against IsEnabled, and this is getting inherited because IsEnabled is an inheritable DP.  I'll file a bug in our internal database for this.

Funny it is, the coming year of testing we are going to write testscenarios for these, to set an example ...
... just kidding: we are only human.

I had this behaviour too. In my case it only happened when I had Widths (also Min and Max) set for my columns, Maybe TemplateColumns , I didn't test for that. 
My workaround came by accident when I - in order to make only row accessible and editable at the time - wanted to set each row its IsEnabled-property individually, If you like that as a temporarily solution, search in Visibal's blogs for that. Best you set that property and others on the events that are there for you, like f.e the loading,of a row, rather than somewhere else. When data is not yet loaded or the grid is not directly visible (f.e. on a nonselected tabpage) not every item returns a row inmediately. A disadvantage is that you maybe have to disable more behaviour. 

Best regards,

Eric Gehring
